title: SAP CEO Steps Down
text:
By Asa Fitch

German business-software giant SAP SE Thursday said Chief Executive Bill McDermott wouldn't seek another term and is being replaced in the role with immediate effect.

SAP named Jennifer Morgan and Christian Klein to serve as co-CEOs. Mr. McDermott will act as an adviser until the end of the year.

Mr. McDermott became CEO in 2014 after rising through SAP's ranks, starting as the CEO of SAP America in 2002 and becoming co-CEO of the entire company in 2010. Prior to SAP, he had spent nearly two decades at Xerox Corp.

Activist investor Elliott Management Corp. in April said it had taken a stake worth 1.2 billion euros ($1.32 billion) in SAP, calling the business-software company undervalued.

Ms. Morgan joined SAP in 2004 and most recently ran its cloud-computing business. Mr. Klein was SAP's chief operating officer.

SAP Thursday also announced preliminary third-quarter results, including per-share earnings of 1.04 euros ($1.14), beating analysts' expectations of 0.82 euros per share.
